instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

since i believe there is no board view and schematics, i am using <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

This board was liquid damaged, repaired all obvious damage, and computer works fine until i close the lid, it wakes up but has no backligh
i can see the image in the background, 

any ideas where should i start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message: Hello guys, I’m still stuck on this one. Any suggestion helps, thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message: The backlight doesn’t come back after the MacBook is set to sleep by closing the lid but it does come back fine if it’s set to sleep from within. Please see attached video of the issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message: Sounds like corrosion on the lid sensor like bjf said. Inspect it for corrosion

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message:
There was no corrosion at all in this area, 

and looked again, no corrosion, should I still replace just to make sure is good?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message:
Why don't you measure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal?
See if you get correct value and stable after lid is open.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and check everything around <CHIP>U5255</CHIP>. I'm betting one of those resistors is blown or you have a continuity issue there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damaged - Works when lid open from sleep, no backlight
threads.message: replaced the customers board, at the end the board would flash for a split second then go away,
